tool.name: Summary.seqs
tool.command: mothur_wrapper.py --cmd='summary.seqs' --result='^mothur.\S+\.logfile$:'$logfile,'^\S+\.summary$:'$out_summary --outputdir='$logfile.extra_files_path' --fasta="$fasta" #if $name.__str__ != "None" and len($name.__str__) > 0: --name="$name" #end if #if $count.__str__ != "None" and len($count.__str__) > 0: --count="$count" #end if --processors=\${GALAXY_SLOTS:-8}

param.name: count
param.label: count - a count_table
param.help: The count file is similar to the name file in that it is used to represent the number of duplicate sequences for a given representative sequence.

tool.help:
@MOTHUR_OVERVIEW@
**Command Documenation**
The summary.seqs_ command will summarize the quality of sequences in an unaligned or aligned fasta-formatted sequence file.
.. _summary.seqs: http://www.mothur.org/wiki/Summary.seqs
